page.title: 03Wildlife of the Reservoir
page.content: The banks along the southern side of the reservoir are planted with copper beech,alder,willow and horse_chestnut trees.Lots of young frog hoppers were found.On the 17th May 1985 a group spent 2 sessions bird watching near the reservoir.The water was checked for wildfowl and close observation was made of the sandbanks,marshy areas and reed beds.A tufted duck was seen diving for food and several male mallards.A female mallard was also spotted leading seven ducklings down the edge of the reservoir.Willow warblers were seen and heard in the waterside willows.Other species observed were moorhen,common sandpiper,pied wagtail and swallow.The reservoir is not used for fishing or sailing.
